column5: I was at sail, They are just about ready to bring in their spring stock. A lot of stuff still empty from last year. Ended up going to another local sporting goods shop to pick a line¬†counter for reeI was after. everybody saying it‚Äôs going to¬†go quick. I think I‚Äôll dig through my stuff make a list soon.
Big fish eat little fish, and it seems there is a lot of that going around in the tackle industry too. A lot of those out of stock items may not be produced by the next owner?

I was having a hard time getting certain hooks for my fly tying . When I found stock,I bought more then I needed . I hate sitting here with no hooks. Now I look ,and I have more hooks packs then I thought . LOL  Anyone know where to buy bulk packs of Mustad Ultra point octopus beak wide gap red size 4 and 6 ? Prefer .CA sites.
And if you can help Brian with hooks, perhaps you could provide a link to a good beard trimming device at a good price! LMAO HH
All trimmed up Joe. Even kept some for flys. LOL
All Premier St Croix musky rods are non stock on their website

Trying to find grizzly hackle ,is like looking for a pin in a hay stack . I have even resorted to state side shops. Out of stock. D rib just the same . Resorting to stretch tubing instead. It,s Crazy how once you could get¬† anytime,and now you got to search high and low .
Maybe we should all go back to Worms!

I'm going old school and using what I have from my years of gathering till it's gone.¬† I got that bait years ago as it worked then and I'm sure still works now.¬† So for me it's a dig back to my gear that hasn't been used in years lure wise.¬† However if I need to replace a rod or reel, I will try my old stock 1st then go out to the online (local - ptbo tackel and others) shops.¬† Facebook groups are seeing some way off prices too either way high or oddly low. Good luck all looking but this year I'm slowing it down and not going to splurge unless needed.
https://www.bassmaster.com/gear/pure-fishing-announces-plans-purchase-plano You have to wonder if a new owner might cut some of a product line?

just a reminder friends...rather than buying at big box canadian tire, walmart and even bass pro. Support local, Gangons, Natural sports, Pro J and Peterborough pro tackle all sell the same gear or better while allowing you to support small business!
^^ second to that. I was truly good boy this season, all shopping done locally. In some cases I was given really good deals.

just placed an order far larger than i should have with peterborough pro tackle...rather have extra supplies then need to run to the box store because im short. THats usually what ends up happening, im like Oh crap im out of dropshot hooks and i head to canadian tire. Not this time.
Last 2 orders have been with flymart. They are an ontario store up north. Quick service so far.

x3........Grimsby Tackle and Fishing World are it for me.¬† Bass Pro, and Cabelas are dead to me for all my fishing¬†and hunting needs - if you want to act like a corporation you better be¬†prepared to be treated like one by your customers.

Ontario - Fishing world, Grimsby Tackle, Natural Sports, Canadiantacklestore.com, Ramakko's. I've ordered from these. pokeystackle.ca¬†in Sask. Ordered some mounts and humminbird wires there. Cabelas when on sale and Sail.ca because they actually have stock of things I want. I ordered tungsten punching weights from a supplier in China. No way I'm paying Canadian retail prices for those.¬† And a few things from the US that I can't find here.
Try Bill's Bait & Tackle in Hamilton on Upper James
Forgot about that place! Just had a look. They have a good deal going on Shimano SLX rods..... Wish I saw that two days ago.
As an industry sales rep, I have seen the shortages already! If you see something that you want, I would grab it!

I‚Äôm starting my shopping list and want to load up on gear early. I‚Äôm seeing stuff out of stock already. Not sure if it‚Äôs due to the severe product shortages we saw by mid season last year or not.¬† 	every place I went to last year looked as if they were going out of business. Even the CT‚Äôs were totally gutted. anyone anticipating¬†the same thing this year?
Stocking up on what.
Gear aka tackle, lures reels. I‚Äôm looking for an Okuma reel that seems to be out of stock everywhere.
Everything is low on stock due to Covid.
Supply chain issues?
There‚Äôs a massive shortage, we struggle up here to get stock in the first place but even the Americans are complaining.
What gives? We‚Äôre trucking along as normal (industry) so why supply chain issues with recreational product?¬† 	shipping lanes not open yet due to winter?

It's a real thing. Actually a REEL thing üòâ Many stores inventory were depleted last year with more people fishing. This winter all stores booked much bigger¬†orders to restock and prepare for another busy season. Add to the fact that there were n still are supply chain issues and shipping delays and you get the current situation.

I think you have started out a tad late.¬† This has been going on for over a¬†year now.¬† Fishing & hunting gear, ammo, bicycles, boats & boating accessories, & athletic equipment are in short order and this is driving up prices. I am in the process of outfitting a new boat and have been buying up rods/reels, fishing tackle and boat accessories all winter because I had zero confidence that these items will be available come spring.¬† Some items I needed to order out of the US or on Amazon because I could not find it in Canada.¬† My first stop was Fishing World and/or Grimsby Tackle, then amazon, then I'm looking on-line (Canada or USA).¬† Not one item purchased from BPS or Cabelas. - O'Brian Water Skis, Minnkota iPilot kit for trolling motor, 2 trolling rods and counter reels, planer boards, Navionics + card,¬†snap weights, over $200 in lures and tackle, boat storage cover, rod holders (x4), new life jackets (x3), & a bow mounted fish finder.

I hear you. I‚Äôve been ordering and accumulated a few k in boat goodies for this winters rebuild. Lots of waiting time and delays. I figured that most things would have been replenished, but you might be well right. I watched a Scotty downrigger go out of stock on me yesterday right in front of my eyes...add to cart, oops. Too late!
A number of production facilities have been shut down, on and off.¬† Others, to provide social distancing, have reduced number of employees in plant at any one time.
Not sure about up there, but I have bought a few things here in the last few months.  https://www.facebook.com/groups/fishinggearfleamarket

Like you, I'm trying to beat the rush. I bought a bunch of stuff from Angling Outfitters, Cabela's, Sail, Fishing World and Canadian Tire already. Canadian Tire actually had a certain soft bait I couldn't find anywhere else. I picked up all sorts of flipping and EWG hooks, lines, and baits. Had to order tungsten flipping weights from China (way cheaper anyways).
I heard from a local marine dealer that they expect a tougher year for parts. I was going to sell a pair of motors but I think I‚Äôll keep one back as back up.
I'm having more trouble with not made anymore. Does anybody want to sell an Abu Koster in 28 gram size Grrrrr
Only half the post showed up  we been slaying lake trout with them and a 6 pounder broke off at the hole Monday  hence the Grrrr
Found some rapala jigging raps i was looking for at fishing world. Most colors are out of stock. Lucky to find some. Most places are depleted or out of stock.

Same. I looked at new boats just after Christmas. I was lucky enough to find a brand new 2019 Lund that a dealer still had in stock.¬† Since then I've bought many of the things you listed because I had no confidence I'd be able to find them come spring. On the plus side, I discovered a few great fishing shops across Canada that I didn't know existed (and offer free shipping).
I saw lots of them at a local store here the other day
Please feel free to share these shops!
Grimsby Tackle has maintained good stock
Hiway variety store Sault

The old saying ‚Äúbuy it cheap and stack it deep‚Äù doesn‚Äôt just apply to ammunition. There is a reason I have pegboard on the walls of my shop. ¬†I haven‚Äôt had to buy anything other than fish hooks a few bags of lead and spawn mesh fora long time. ¬†If I see a deal on something I regularly y use, I buy as much as I can reasonably afford.
